items.description: Coast from Heacham to north of King's Lynn in Norfolk
items.message:
This alert is in force from 6pm today, Sunday 14th January, until 12:30am on Tuesday 16th January. Large waves and sea spray are expected to affect the seafront as a result of strong winds developing throughout today. Areas most at risk are Heacham, Snettisham, Ingoldisthorpe, Dersingham and Wolferton. 

The detailed forecast is for a peak level of 4.73mAODN at 8:15pm this evening, Sunday 14 January, which is 0.81m above tide tables, wind Force 6, North Westerly.

The following two tides on Monday at 9:00am and 9:00pm are currently forecast to be a Flood Alert. The detailed forecast for the tide at 9am Monday morning is for a peak level of 4.54mAODN, which is 1.16m above tide tables, wind Force 7, North Westerly. (mAODN is height above average sea level, for more info refer to local tide tables). 

Take care on beaches, coastal roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself or others in danger. We are monitoring the situation and are not expecting it to escalate. 

We will update this message by 11am tomorrow,15/01/2024.

items.description: Northumberland coast
items.message:
Sunday afternoons tide at 5:15 PM will be higher than normal due to high spring tides and strong winds. 

Areas most at risk include beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads along the coast, particularly in the Seahouses North Pier, Beadnell Harbour Road North, Alnmouth River Footpath and Newbiggin Bay North Promenade areas. Flooding is possible between 3:00 PM and 7:30 PM on 14/01/2024.

We are expecting higher than normal tides over the next two days and as a result we may issue further alerts.

We will continue to monitor levels closely.

Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous.

This message will be updated by 8:00 PM on 14/01/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Trent at Alkborough Flats
items.message:
River levels are rising at the Keadby river gauge as a result of high spring tides.  Flooding is possible on high tide at approximately 21:30 on 14/01/24 at Alkborough Flats.
  
Areas most at risk are the Alkborough Flats. The Keadby river gauge is forecast to overtop the lower spillway and result in flooding.   
We expect river levels to peak on the high tide at 21:30 on 14/01/24 at the Keadby river gauge. The high tide levels on the 15/01/24 are forecasted to be below the flood risk threshold for Alkborough Flats.

We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are patrolling watercourses in the area. Please avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses and avoid contact with flood water.  

This message will be updated by 22:00 on 14/01/24, or as the situation changes.

items.message:

Areas most at risk are Keadby, Amcotts, Owston, Burringham, Gunness, Althorpe, East Butterwick, Flixborough, Gunness Lane and, Neap House road.

We are closely monitoring the situation and our incident response staff are patrolling watercourses in the area.  
Please avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses and avoid contact with flood water.  
This message will be updated by 22:00 this evening, 14/01/24, or as the situation changes.

items.description: North Sea at Roker, Sunderland
items.message:

This message will be updated by 8:30 PM on 14/01/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.description: King's Lynn, West Lynn and The Wash frontage in Norfolk
items.message:
Large waves and sea spray are expected to affect the seafront as a result of strong winds developing throughout today, 14/01/2024. Areas most at risk are King's Lynn, West Lynn, Clenchwarton, Terrington St Clement, Walpole Cross Keys and Tilney All Saints. 

The detailed forecast is for a peak level of 4.73mAODN at 8:15pm today, 14 January, which is 0.81m above tide tables, wind Force 6, North Westerly. (mAODN is height above average sea level, for more info refer to local tide tables). 

The following tide on Monday at 9:00am is currently forecast to be below the Alert threshold. 

Take care on coastal roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself or others in danger. We are monitoring the situation and are not expecting it to escalate. 

We will update this message by 11am tomorrow, 15/01/2024.

items.description: Humber estuary from Hessle Haven to Faxfleet
items.message:
This Flood Alert has been issued due to the high tide forecast on Sunday evening (14/01/2024) between 8:15PM and 10:30PM. The tide is expected to be higher than normal due to the effect of positive surge and spring tides. Areas most at risk are around East Clough in the Melton area. Tides on Monday are also expected to be higher than normal, but are currently below levels of concern in the forecast. 
We will continue to work with emergency services and local authorities and to keep closely monitoring the situation. We will re-issue this flood alert for any additional tides of concern. 
Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous.
This message will be updated by 9:00 AM on Monday 15/01/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.description: North Sea coast at Skipsea, Hornsea and Mappleton
items.message: This Flood Alert for the North Sea Coast at Skipsea, Hornsea and Mapplelton has been issued due to the combination of high tides, surge, and wave action forecast on Sunday evening (14/01/2024) between 6:00 PM and 9:00 PM, and on Monday morning (15/01/2024) between 7:00 AM and 9:00 AM. Areas most at risk include properties from Marine Drive, along South Promenade, Hornsea Burton Road and along Stream Dike and Foss Beck. We are expecting higher than normal tides on Sunday 14th January and Monday 15th January as a result of spring tides and positive surge. Wave action will also be a hazard. As a result we may issue further alerts and warnings. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary. Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous. This message will be updated by 09:00 PM on Sunday 14/01/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.description: North Sea coast at Easington and Kilnsea
items.message:
This Flood Warning has been issued due to the combination of spring tides, positive surge and waves on Sunday evening (14/01/2024) between 7:00PM and 8:15PM. Areas most at risk include properties on the east side of Kilnsea around Southfield Farm.
Overtopping waves and windblown spray are possible between these times.
Tides will be higher than astronomical tides on Sunday 14th January and Monday 15th January due to positive surge. Wave action will also be a hazard particularly on Sunday evening and Monday morning with the potential for windblown spray along exposed coastlines. As a result we may need to update this flood warning for further tides.
Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous. This message will be updated by 9PM on Sunday 14/01/2024 or as the situation changes
